title: England men's 'big three' teams have learnt how to seize the moment - finally there is reward for the emotional hell we endure
text:
That galloping sound is England teams finally catching up in the big three sports. Catching up with Olympic gold medalists, world champion boxers and all the other folk who have filled the void left by the men’s main national sides.

Void: too strong a word? No. English sport’s dirty secret is that the big three lag far behind the ‘lesser’ disciplines that have blessed us with Dina Asher-Smith, Lewis Hamilton and Jessica Ennis-Hill. Television viewing figures affirm that England teams are the largest prism for watching sport. England’s women drew 11.7 million this summer for their semi-final against USA and the men’s team’s semi with Croatia in Russia last year peaked at 26.5m.

In five tide-changing...
description: That galloping sound is England teams finally catching up in the big three sports.
